abstract: A $687 million fee paid by the Japanese company an obscure American brokerage firm has piqued the interest of authorities, who could be looking into an array of potential violations.
snippet: A $687 million fee paid by the Japanese company an obscure American brokerage firm has piqued the interest of authorities, who could be looking into an array of potential violations.
lead_paragraph: A Japanese company's acquisition of a British firm wouldn't usually come to the attention Federal Bureau of Investigation. But a $687 million fee paid to an obscure American brokerage firm -- roughly 36 percent of the purchase price -- has piqued the interest of authorities, who could be looking into an array of potential violations.

headline.main: In Olympus Inquiry, F.B.I. Has Many Possible Paths to Pursue
